meanings.definition: To make someone feel annoyed or irritated.
meanings.sent1: Her constant interruptions galled him during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The loud music galled the neighbors late at night.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel galled the grumpy old cat by stealing its food.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic jam galled him like a thorn in his side.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive sound of the dripping faucet galled her to the point of frustration.

meanings.sent1: She was galled by his rude behavior at the party.
meanings.sent2: The constant noise from the construction site galled the residents of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The misbehaving puppy galled its owner by chewing on the furniture.
meanings.sent4: The unfair treatment galled him like a bitter taste in his mouth.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive questions galled her more and more with each passing minute.

meanings.sent1: He had a galled expression after waiting in line for hours.
meanings.sent2: The galled customer demanded to speak to the manager about the poor service.
meanings.sent3: The galled student sighed loudly when given extra homework.
meanings.sent4: Her galled mood was evident from the frown on her face.
meanings.sent5: The galled look in his eyes showed his frustration with the situation.
